rComments: His class is dry, but it's very straight forward and easy to follow. Didn't get the book. Homework is easy. Quizzes are easy. Midterm was just like the practice one. The review sheets he has make it easy to study for the tests.

he's boring and just reads off the slides, completely monotone and it's extremely difficult to stay engaged no matter how hard you try. with this class there were no sections or tutors available so there was no way for me to get extra help and no choice but to fall behind every class. midterms and papers are not relevant to lectures whatsoever.

Horrible teacher. Completely reads off of the slides, and can barely explain anything in detail. Can't do basic math, let alone calculus. Gives homework problems on stuff that he has never taught us how to do. Teaches things that do not follow along with the textbook. Don't take him, especially during the summer. One of the worst teachers ever.

This class wasn't really that hard. I didn't take any econ classes for 3 years and yet it wasn't that much of a challenge for me. The problem sets are doable and of reasonable difficulty. Go to section for help. The  midterms are ok, with the first one being pretty easy. The final is relatively hard. He's not that good at teaching.
WORST TEACHER IVE EVER HAD. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. DOESNT EXPLAIN ANYTHING AND TAKES FOREVER TO POST GRADES. DONT KNOW HOW HE STILL HAS A JOB

This is the most challenging class I've taken at UCSC. There were 6 problem sets due during the quarter, which were challenging, but prepared you well for the two midterms. Lecture is not mandatory and would recommend going to section instead. Really hard final.

Justin speaks clearly and confidently about his subject, however he does not know how to dumb down for hos students. He does not explain why things are the way they are, he just tells you what to do. The class is entirely based on examples and the homework is really hard and graded. But, if you go to MSI and study you should be fine.

He's a nice guy and knows the material, but he really needs to be more assertive about telling people to shut their mouths. People are incredibly rude in his class and talk the entire time. He also takes an incredibly long time to grade assignments which can be pretty irritating. But overall not too bad. Textbook used very rarely.

The course grade is not very fair. He bases 20% of your grade on a group project, and both of my team members didn't turn in anything. I'm a Econ & Math double major, and had a 4.0 in college before I took this class. Not recommended at all.

He's a nice guy, but the class was pretty hard unless the topic rocks your world, and you can bring a lot of prior knowledge to the table. He teaches very MBA-style, with little guidance and with no "second chances." You get it or you don't.. and most people didn't. He also requires group work with a combined group grade. :(
Really nice guy, not-bad lectures. HARD final (i screwed up for sure)

This guy is pretty boring, he should have gone into public radio or PBS. I thought the class was way too easy. I went to lecture maybe 5 times, but a bunch of idiots thought it was hard. he basically just does whats in the book. read the book, and you will be fine.

ugh most boring lecture ever. his voice is so smoothing that puts you to sleep LOLz! i think he gave most of my class a C because more than 75% of the class failed... -_-   he was kind of hot tho.. lol
Most boring lecture ever, I didn't attend most classes.  No penalty for missed classes or sections, so if you are a smart student who can learn on his/her own then he isn't that bad.

I would never take the time to rate a professor but I feel that I am obligated to do so for the well being of my fellow peers. He is awful! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! the most boring lecture you will ever have.

Not a great professor, but the class is a hard class to teach anyways. Ask him a question and he won't know how to answer it. Go to section and MSI for homework and help (it really helps). He's a nice guy though, just not good at explaining the content.
lecture was useless

Tests are HARD. The average grade for midterms were 51/85, final grades weren't much better. Kept handing out homework that required MSI visits to complete. He's not too sharp on answering questions, either -- ask him a question and he'll somehow bring up an unrelated topic. Wouldn't recommend him to my worst enemy.

The material in this class is hard and all Marion does is define it, he doesnt explain it. He tries really hard to help when you ask, but he is not very clear and hard to understand. The curve is GIANT!
the stuff is hard, but he's nice about his grading
dude is stoned, work is hard, not enough msi

He is very insecure and uncertain in front of the class. He relies too heavily on his notes and pre-planned examples. When asked to elaborate on his points he is unable to explain his thoughts in a different context. He is easily stumped and makes mistakes when he attempts to do anything ad hoc. Nice guy, poor teacher.

Im not an econd major so im not sure how other professors are in this deparment but I found Prof. Marion to be very confusing.  The class was really easy though and the material is pretty basic so there wasn't much of a problem.  I really hope that other professors int his department are better.

First of all 100A is a hard class no matter who teaches it. Marion's lecture were very hard to understand but he tried his best. The subject is very hard to teach and understand. He gave a very generous curve, probably because the class didn't do too well. He's nice guy tho.
HUGE curve. I don't know anyone who failed, even though many people should have. He's a nice guy, tries to teach well but i'm not sure how well he succeeds because the subject is really hard.

I would stay away from this teach until he gets a few more quarters under his belt.  He's very new and doesn't convey the material clearly.  Timid and shy. HW was soo... hard, spent many hrs. in MSI.  And lectures are straight from the book.  Final was impossible although large curve.

he is horrible!!!  he only regurates the book.  he erased at least 5 times on each topic per day because he didn't know what he was talking about.  what until another professor teaches.  he is very unclear, very unsure of himself, very unhelpful with teaching it.  the only way i passed was with the MSI teacher!!!

Doesn't know how to teach...yet.  In a few quarters he should be fine.  He is a very nice person, just doesn't know how to teach the subject yet.  This made the HW and final very difficult.  I put more effort in this class than in any other class and it didn't pay off.  Although there was a HUGE curve at the end, I would still take someone else. :(

I could easily follow the lectures, they were just dry. Chose to require simplier math approach, most appreciated. Definitely knows the material, needs more practice in delivering. Very accessable, wants to be helpful. I do question some choices of which material to emphasize. Real world examples would have made it much more interesting.

I have no doubt that he will get better with time.  He obviously knows his stuff, but he has some trouble explaining things effectively.  My experience is that he's very willing to help however he can...he's much more helpful outside of class.  I would have liked the homework and lectures to have been more in sync.

Procrastinates with passing back homeworks, solutions, helpful information!  Does not know how to articulate material in a way that students will actually understand.  I felt like I was in an honors course where there was a lot expected from me.  This class didn't have TAs or helpful supplemental material.

he doesn't really know how to explain the materials. i spent at least 5 hours on each problem set, but the grades aren't what i expected. he is trying to help, but not helpful. if you really want to understand the materials, i don't suggest to take this professor.

Nicest guy in the world. Not the best professor... yet. Problem sets near impossible without TA guidance through every step. He had touble putting the material in specific terms, tended to confuse more than anything. I'm sure he will get better.

Class was easily structured with 1 midterm, 5 problem sets, and a very difficult final. Sometimes he has trouble communicating what he wants to say, but this is his first year here. Hopefully he will improve and make the lectures a little more tolerable.  Econ 100a is not an easy topic, so explaining the sometimes abstract material would be easier.

Like what the other reviewer mentioned. Marion is a new teacher and teaches from his set of notes. He avoids anwsering specific question, in fear of confusing students. His midterm and final were very difficult, but the grading for the exams where very very easy. I guess it balances out?
New professor. Sometimes he'll stutter over the material he's teaching. I hate when a professor teaches something and he/she doesn't know well the material that is being taught.
